Course_description: This one-semester general physics is specially designed for students whose future career interests are programming, AI, or interdisciplinary. The course will have an emphasis on simulation and calculation with the computer language "Python."
Teaching_methods:
專題探討/製作
習作
討論
講授
Assessment_methods:
書面報告
出席狀況
口頭報告
作業
作品
測驗
Course_content:
1. Mechanics
Motion and Vectors
Introduction of Calculus
Newton's Laws
Conservation Laws: Momentum and Energy
Oscillations
2. Waves
Description of a Wave
Wave Equation
Interference and Superposition
Phasors and Complex Numbers
Sound
Doppler Effect
3. Electricity
Charge and Coulomb's Law
Electric Fields and Gauss' Law
Electric Potential and Electric Potential Energy
Capacitance and Electric Energy
Current
Ohm's Law
Resistor Network
RC Circuit
4. Magnetism
Magnetic Fields
Magnetic Forces on Charges and Currents
Magnetic Fields Due to Currents
Faraday's Law
Induction and Inductors
Magnetic Energy
LC Circuits
RLC Circuits
Transformers
5. Maxwell Equation and Light
Maxwell Equation
Electromagnetic Waves and Lights
6. Optics
Images and Lenses
Double-Slit Experiments
Michelson's Interferometer

7. Computation Related Physics
Data and Noise
Two-States Systems: 0 and 1
Switches and Logics
Information
Quantum Computers: Quantum States
Evaluation:
Midterm + Final Exams 50 %
Python Simulation 20 %
Final Report and Presentation 15 % (Group Project)
Quiz and Class Performance 15 %
Textbook:
Halliday & Resnick’s Principles of Physics, based on the 11th Edition, Global Edition

Any Python programming guide
